intro: Mirabilis triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered four-o'clock, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that open in the late afternoon and close at dawn. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces three flowers per inflorescence, which are usually pink or red in color. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a slightly hairy texture. Mirabilis triflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained soils in full sun.
